sentence.text: Patient 2 was delivered normally at 41 weeks 3 days gestation weighing 3.43 kg.
Antenatal scans had shown hypoplastic kidneys, a prominent cisterna magna, bilateral radioulna fusion and oligosyndactyly.
At birth, he was confirmed to have similar, almost symmetrical, limb changes to his older brother (Figs. 2 and 3).
Renal ultrasound scanning showed that the right kidney was smaller measuring 4.6 cm (fifth centile for age is 4.9 cm) as well as being low-lying and malrotated.
The left kidney measured 5.1 cm and appeared normal.
Both kidneys had simplex collecting systems.
MAG3 scanning showed that both kidneys handled tracer normally with 58% function on the left and 42% on the right.
At 2.5 years of age, he has also had symptomatic hypoglycaemias during intercurrent illnesses and is currently being investigated for suspected ketotic hypoglycaemias.
His most recent growth height at 2.7 years of age was 91.9 cm (25–50th centile) with a weight of 11.45 kg (9th centile).
He has mild global developmental delay, but is otherwise in good health.
